name: ADDvocate: Anti-Discrimination Dialogue for Social Justice
base_name: ADDvocate: Anti-Discrimination Dialogue for Social Justice
long_desc: The aim of this multidisciplinary course is to establish a firm, educationbased understanding of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion topics in Pittsburgh, Qatar and Worldwide to enhance their classroom and university experience. Through a series of lectures by subject experts, this course aims to educate and raise consciousness of discrimination, racism and bias in the real world. This course will also highlight strategies to become an active bystander and advocate for fair treatment in all our communities.

custom_fields.goals: 1.Illustrate greater awareness about ones own culturebound perceptions, assumptions, experiences, and implicit biases2.Educate and raise consciousness of discrimination, racism, and bias both explicit and implicit3.Offer a safe and constructive space for active recognition about and discussion of realworld issues4.Develop tools to become an active bystander and advocate for fair treatment in our CMUQ community and Qatar5.Create a global citizen cognizant of realworld issues with a greater understanding of and appreciation for diversity
custom_fields.key_topics:
Understanding Personal Identity
Introducing, Defining discrimination and understanding its effects.
Slavery
Stereotypes
Allyship and social justice
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Attendance (10%); Participation (10%); Contribution to discussion board (15%); Reflections (35%); Action plan workbook (20%); Project showcase (10%)
custom_fields.relevance: The aim of this multidisciplinary course is to establish a firm, education-based understanding of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion topics in Qatar, Pittsburgh and Worldwide to enhance the classroom and university experience for our students.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Textbook and Selected readings and videos
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students may be requested to attend talks on or off campus.
